creator: heiner.amthauer@t-systems.de
text:
In the distributed files server.xml and server-noexamples.xml.config, which 
come with Tomcat 4.0.1, you'll find the following configuration error of 
service "Tomcat-Apache":

the attribute appBase="..." is found inside the "Engine" tag. If one reads the 
manual, one can find that this attribute belongs inside the "Host" tag, which 
itself should be wrapped by the "Engine" tag.

Please correct this in the next distribution. I've found lots of ppl being 
confused about this.

Greetings
Heiner

--------------------------------- Demonstration ----------------------------
**WRONG:**
  <!-- Define an Apache-Connector Service -->
  <Service name="Tomcat-Apache">
    <Connector className="org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnector".../>

    <Engine className="org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpEngine"
     ... appBase="webapps">
      ...
    </Engine>
  </Service>

**RIGHT:**
  <!-- Define an Apache-Connector Service -->
  <Service name="Tomcat-Apache">
    <Connector className="org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnector".../>

    <Engine className="org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpEngine" ... > 
      <Host ... appBase="webapps"/>
      ...
    </Engine>
  </Service>

creator: jfclere@gmail.com
text:
No that is 100% not correct: the appBase could be in WarpConnector.
The Hosts are deployed by the WarpConfigurationHandler class.
I will change the files.
